Text.Value: A weaponsmith, huh? Not sure if he's the guy, but I'd love to find out. A tune-up would do this rusty heart a world of good.
They were agents of a devil. I wasn't going to let them roam the area unchallenged.
You... did? Wow. That was sound of you. Why'd you do it?

EditorData.NodeContext: Wanting to accept the favor but experience has made her wary of trusting (this is early in her relationship to the player)

Text.Value: I always take care of my people.
I met someone who might be able to help - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.
Hey, soldier. We've got a long way ahead of us - and there's something I want to tell you.
How the hells did you get an infernal engine for a heart?
Won't be seeing my mechanic any time soon, so I've been making the most of the extra heat. But it's meant I can't get too friendly. If I'm excited, nervous, scared, I'll light you up like a firework.
Thanking you. A tune-up would give this rustbox of mine a new lease on life.
I already took care of those Paladins of Tyr  - you don't need to worry about them anymore.
Burn, baby. As hot as I can tolerate. I have to admit it helps in battle, though I wouldn't have chosen it for myself - if I'd been given a choice.

EditorData.NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

Text.Value: Wild, right? And believe it or not, I'm one of Zariel's least-mutilated pets.
It's important to me. Are you going to help me or not?

EditorData.NodeContext: If this goes badly, she could leave the party. So medium tension.

Text.Value: I'm always keen for a good fight.
Who knows! Maybe I can run like this indefinitely. But... maybe not.
Don't worry. It's nothing bad. Well. Depending.
Then again, facing 'em down might've put my tin can into overdrive.

EditorData.NodeContext: She's about to explain her infernal heart for the first time.

Text.Value: What does the engine allow you to do?
Before we head off, there's something I want you to know.
The first time I faced down those 'paladins,' they let slip they'd met an infernal mechanic in the area. A tiefling. But I didn't see him anywhere.
Agreed. We'll make sure they can't hurt anyone again.
High pain tolerance. And a dynamic duo of truly shitty bosses.
Yes! Now we're talking.
It's not a priority. Get in line or go it alone.
Good luck. I'm gonna miss you. You better miss me too. Or else.

EditorData.NodeContext: Leaving the party and sad about it, but hiding behind a bit of humor as a defense.

Text.Value: Leave.
I'm not willing to let servants of Zariel roam the Sword Coast unchecked. Or to regroup and come after me again. Let's go get 'em. Together.
Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Thing's been running in overdrive since I left Avernus.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
"Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)
EditorData.NodeContext: A bit more tired/ worn out than when she says this in Act 1 (this is only if she hasn't told player about her heart by act 2)
EditorData.SFXTags: [EG] Karlach fist thumping chest (metalic sounds), metal clang (inside body, muffled)

Text.Value: Wish I could've been there to watch those ignots crumble, but I'm just happy they're off my tail.
I'll keep an eye out for someone like that.
There are some tieflings holed up in a druid's grove nearby. We might look there.
Well. Alone it is.

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised. The player has said they aren't going to solve her quest with her.

Text.Value: I'll tell you the story, but I really need to find someone who can tune up my engine sooner rather than later. Believe me when I say this thing is hot.
If it's that important to you, you have my support. We'll find them together.
If you can lead the way, I'll gladly follow.
Well now! Maybe I could make his acquaintance? A tightened screw or two might let me keep a little calmer.
We have important things to do, Karlach. Cutting down Zariel's lackeys isn't one of them.
If this is really goodbye, soldier, I guess... well... thanks for everything. I'd hoped we'd be able to stick together a bit longer, but that's life, isn't it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Surprised. The player has said they aren't going to solve her quest with her.

Text.Value: Glad to be counted among them. Really glad.
You're my kind of people.
You have a mechanic for your heart?
What'll happen if you don't get tuned up?
Wonder if they meant Dammon - a tiefling weaponsmith.
Maybe even manage a pat or bump without burning someone to death. It's been a long time.
Hey, soldier. I'm getting a little nervous. We're getting further and further from those pricks who were hunting me.
Same. Wish you would've brought me along for the ride, but I'm just happy those ignots are off my tail.
Sounds like a good lead. Hopefully, our guy will be among them. A tune-up would do this old tub a world of good.

Synopsis: If players didn't finish Paladins of Tyr nor don't know about Karlach's infernal engine she will remind them about that. If they decide to continue without helping her she permanently leaves the party.
